product_name: Juvia's PlaceI am Magic Silky Finishing Powder (Talc Free)
summary: SummaryWhether you're perfecting your beat or going for a no-makeup makeup look, Juvia's Place I am Magic Silky Finishing Powder elevates your makeup while keeping everything locked in with a featherlight touch.
details: DetailsFeaturesIndulge in luxurious final step to a perfected complexion. Delivers a light-as-air, soft-matte finish with a velvety texture that melts into skin. It's your secret weapon for a smooth, filtered finish that lasts all day.Flawless, Soft-Focus Effect: Minimizes the look of pores, fine lines, and texture.Weightless Wear: Ultra-light, breathable formula that never looks heavy or chalky.Controls Shine: Keeps oil in check for a beautifully balanced matte finish.Talc-Free: Finely milled, paraben-free, and gentle on all skin types.Shade Inclusive: Eight adaptable shades designed to brighten, set, and enhance every skin tone.Item 2635311How To UseAfter applying foundation and concealer, lightly dip a fluffy brush or powder puff into the powder.Tap off excess and gently press or sweep onto the skin, focusing on areas prone to shine - like the T-zone and under the eyes.Use a light hand for an all-over set, or press in extra product to bake and brighten targeted zones.Pro MUA Tips:For under-eye brightening, use a slightly lighter shade like Whipped Cream or Cotton Candy and press it in with a damp sponge.Use a tighter brush for targeted oil control around the nose, chin, and forehead.To extend wear, apply a light dusting over primer before foundation, then set again afterward for added longevity.For photoshoots or flash photography, use sparingly to avoid flashback - this formula is finely milled to stay undetectable on camera when blended properly.
how_to_use: After applying foundation and concealer, lightly dip a fluffy brush or powder puff into the powder.Tap off excess and gently press or sweep onto the skin, focusing on areas prone to shine - like the T-zone and under the eyes.Use a light hand for an all-over set, or press in extra product to bake and brighten targeted zones.Pro MUA Tips:For under-eye brightening, use a slightly lighter shade like Whipped Cream or Cotton Candy and press it in with a damp sponge.Use a tighter brush for targeted oil control around the nose, chin, and forehead.To extend wear, apply a light dusting over primer before foundation, then set again afterward for added longevity.For photoshoots or flash photography, use sparingly to avoid flashback - this formula is finely milled to stay undetectable on camera when blended properly.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: Silky finish

reviews.headline: YES !!
reviews.comments: this is the step in my makeup routine ive been missing !! super pretty, love the finish, i have oily skin and 3 hours in its still looking beautiful

reviews.headline: i am a big fan
reviews.comments: the pink one is amazing!! it made my undereye so matte and airbrushed. i just am not a fan of the smell but thats ok

reviews.headline: Crusty
reviews.comments: Made my skin look dry and crusty. I am oily, and even with my natural oils coming through I managed to look dry and oily at the same time. Setting spray didn't help. Not good for under eye at all. It is too grainy and if I touched my face during the day, I could feel the powder on my fingers pilling up and wiping off. This one is a pass for me.

reviews.headline: The best!!!
reviews.comments: I'm usually oily after an hour of putting foundation and powder on, but this powder is AMAZING!!! It keeps the oil and shine away!

reviews.headline: I would definitely buy again
reviews.comments: Love this! It's perfect!!

reviews.headline: Great value and performance
reviews.comments: Great powder that provides soft matte finish.

reviews.headline: Juvia's Place I Am Magic Powder in Coconut Flakes
reviews.comments: This is by far the best powder that I've ever used! It's absolutely amazing and beautiful! Never dry looking or cakey on and keeps my combination skin looking fresh and smooth literally all day! Also, you get a huge amount for such a great price! I'll always use Juvia's Place!

I bought this powder in two colors, both the pink and white one. I dont know whats in this powder but all i have to say is its SO GOOD!!! Literally blurs your face and makes it so your makeup doesnt crease. The pink shade is super flattering on my fair skin as it somehow still brightens my undereye considering im usually the lightest shades when it comes to anything. When you put setting spray on this powder it literally melts into your skin which i personally love. will be going back and getting a third one but in the shade "coconut flakes". Compared to all the drugstore and high end powders, this beats every single one.

reviews.headline: Good for over 40!
reviews.comments: Rarely leave reviews. Been on the hunt for a setting powder that doesnt dry out my eyes. Have mostly dry skin, but more especially on my under eye. First product that smooths, sets everything and has NOT produced dry under eyes tjat accentuate the fine lines im sterting to get! Highly recommend!!

reviews.headline: No
reviews.comments: This is not for oily/combination skin. It made my skin oily within one hour of wearing it. I tested it with different primers and setting sprays and its still oily. The ingredients has a lot of oil in it thats why. If you have dry skin it might work, but not for us oily babes.

reviews.headline: Stunning!
reviews.comments: I have tried so mant different loose powders and this by far is the best i've had. It's perfect for setting makeup or even baking in certain areas. This finish makes your complexion look flawless and soft. This is going to be a stable it my makeup bag from now on! You'll be happy you bought it.

reviews.headline: Perfect Setting Powder
reviews.comments: Love love this product. It is so light weight on the skin and stays all day. I have oily skin and it is perfect for me at work. Will definitely buy again.

reviews.headline: Will be purchasing again
reviews.comments: I love this product...goes Great with my skin

reviews.headline: Cookie Dough (or don't)
reviews.comments: This powder is coarse and dry, reminds me of cornmeal. Too thick for under eye and looks dry and ashy when applied all over. Applied using a puff and different brushes, end result is the same. Even after liberal douse of makeup setting spray, still appears dry and sits on top of skin inabsorbes.

reviews.headline: Helps with hollow eyes
reviews.comments: I have hollow undereyes really bad. Like i need filler its so bad! I usually use the dermablend powder to help with them but i used this on a whim and girlll i love it so much. Keeps me pretty matte for majority of my day being out( 8-12 hours) Just be careful if you took the plastic flim off bc if you drop this big shi its over!

reviews.headline: AMAZING!!!
reviews.comments: You NEED this powder!!!! It beats any other loose setting powder on the market. The shade range is amazing, the amount of product you get is great! There is nothing bad i can say about this product.

reviews.headline: The best powder ever
reviews.comments: So my skin is super dry amd i always had the hardest time looking for a loose powder that doesnt dry me and doesnt crease my eyes. I knew it was the loose powder that was wrong in my makeup routine because ever since i started using this one. It is my favorite. The only loose powder you need. I wear it all day and my makeup still looks so nice. If there is anthing u need in ur makeup rotiune it is this powder. I have the pinkish one btw.

reviews.headline: Loved it on the first try!
reviews.comments: Instantly a yes! Such a pretty blurring powder. Doesnt oxidize foundation of concealer. Silky smooth powder. More of a matte finish but not dry looking. Might be my new holy grail. Im super fair I use and the shade coconut flakes worked for me

reviews.headline: Amazing!!
reviews.comments: If I could reccomend this powder 1,000 times I would. This powder performs better than a lot of high end brands I've tried. It blurs the pores, its long lasting, and has a great finish.

faceoff_positive.comments: My top powder for blurring my pores and mattifying my skin has been Huda's loose powder ever since it came out. I have a Mac NC44/45 skintone and I don't like  an undereye that is too bright. I typically mix Huda's banana bread and blondie shades or just wear blondie on its own. But testing Juvias powder in cookie dough has got me saying Huda who? The shade is perfect for me. It falls in between the Huda shades I mentioned above. My skin looks smooth. The only drawback is the price. The price per ounce is better with Huda but for someone that was mixing 2 shades, this is just fine with me. I just used a 20% off coupon to get it so that makes the price nearly the same.
faceoff_positive.headline: This might replace my Huda

faceoff_negative.comments: Made my skin look dry and crusty. I am oily, and even with my natural oils coming through I managed to look dry and oily at the same time. Setting spray didn't help. Not good for under eye at all. It is too grainy and if I touched my face during the day, I could feel the powder on my fingers pilling up and wiping off. This one is a pass for me.
faceoff_negative.headline: Crusty

rollup.name: I am Magic Silky Finishing Powder (Talc Free)
